events.message: Customer reported a collision involving their vehicle with another car at an intersection during rush hour.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident based on the keywords such as vehicle and collision in the report.
An insurance agent was assigned to handle the vehicle accident claim and coordinate next steps with the customer.
Customer received confirmation that their auto accident claim has been acknowledged and is under review.
Requested photos of the vehicle damage, police report, and driver's license to proceed with the accident investigation.
Customer submitted all requested documents including detailed photos and official police report for review.
The investigation team has begun assessing the car accident details to determine liability and verify damages.
Investigation concluded, confirming collision impact and extent of damages consistent with initial claim.
Settlement proposal sent to customer covering repairs to their vehicle based on damage estimates.
Customer provided feedback on the settlement offer, expressing concerns about repair timelines and costs.
Claim was escalated to senior claims manager for further review due to customerâ€™s concerns about settlement.
Final claim approval issued after review of all documents and consideration of customer feedback.
Payment was processed and issued to cover the cost of repairs as per the approved settlement agreement.
The auto accident claim was officially closed following confirmation of payment receipt and repair progress.
